p: To characterize the ability of the KPF1-HEK and KPF1-Antx hMAbs to recognize native IAV HA proteins, MDCK cells were infected (MOI 10) with Brisbane/H1N1, pH1N1, NC/H1N1, PR8 /H1N1, WI/H1N1, GA/H1N1, or Brisbane/H3N2 and binding was evaluated and quantified by IFA ( Figure 3). Both KPF1-Antx and KPF1-HEK hMAbs recognized all H1N1 IAVs, but not Brisbane/H3N2- or mock-infected cells ( Figure 3A). Quantifying the KPF1-HEK and KPF1-Antx hMAb binding reactivity to infected MDCK cells revealed that KPF1-Antx hMAb showed similar levels of recognition and binding to H1N1-infected MDCK cells as that observed with KPF1-HEK hMAb ( Figure 3B). This result indicated that KPF1-Antx hMAb possesses similar broad cross-reactivity and ability to recognize HA from H1N1 IAV-infected MDCK cells as those observed with the mammalian HEK-produced KPF1 hMAb.
